providerId.description: The Data Management Platform provider identifier. Only applicable to Third party audience segments.

FetchTaxonomyRequestBodyV1.description: The response data will have the categories that are under the given path, and main categories will be returned if no path is specified. The response data also depends on the adType specified here since ad programs may support targeting audiences in certain categories.

countries.description: The ISO Alpha-2 country codes to search audiences from. This field must be specified if the advertiser does not have an associated country. Currently, it is only supported to specify a single country per request.

lowerBoundInclusive.description: The inclusive lower bound for the bucket.  If not specified, the bucket captures all values below the upper bound.

upperBoundExclusive.description: The exclusive upper bound for the bucket.  If not specified, the bucket captures all values above the lower bound.

post.description: Returns a list of audience segments for an advertiser. The result set can be filtered by providing an array of Filter objects. Each item in the resulting set will match all specified filters.

parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

parameters.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use `GET` method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

parameters.description: The advertiser to retrieve segments for. This parameter is required for the DSP adType, but optional for the SD adType.
parameters.name: advertiserId

parameters.description: When set to true, only targetable audience segments will be returned.
parameters.name: canTarget

parameters.description: Token from a previous request. Use in conjunction with the `maxResults` parameter to control pagination of the returned array.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of audiences in the returned array. Use in conjunction with the `nextToken` parameter to control pagination. For example, supplying maxResults=20 with a previously returned token will fetch up to the next 20 items. In some cases, fewer items may be returned.
parameters.name: maxResults

400.description: Bad Request. The request could not be processed or handled. Please correct the issues specified and try again.

403.description: Forbidden. The request failed because the user is unauthenticated or does not have access to the specified resource.

429.description: Too Many Requests. The request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Something went wrong on the server. Retry later and report an error if unresolved.

post.summary: Browse the taxonomy of audience categories

post.description:
Deletes an existing targeting audience based on audience ID. Only available for the audiences of the type: *PRODUCT_PURCHASES*, *PRODUCT_VIEWS*, *PRODUCT_SIMS*, *PRODUCT_SEARCH* and *COMBINED_AUDIENCE*

**Requires one of these permissions**:
["advertiser_campaign_edit","audiences_edit"]

parameters.description: ID that describe DSP advertiser level accounts that exists under a manager account (previously under a DSP entity). The owner of the audience.
parameters.name: AdvertiserId

schema.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use `GET` method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header and choose profile id `profileId` from the response to pass it as input.
